summary: The 'Medicaid Improvement and State Flexibility Act of 2025' amends Title XI of the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid waivers. It allows states to approve and implement experimental Medicaid projects, provided they meet specific criteria. Key provisions include allowing beneficiaries to opt into projects involving electronic benefits transfer cards for primary care and medications, cash payments for remaining funds, and catastrophic insurance. The bill also contains stipulations against funding abortions and ensuring federal expenditures remain the same or lower than without the project.
